question: 旨
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>point</kanji> of something is the <vocabulary>gist</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>principle</vocabulary> of it. So, what's the gist of this vocab word? It's <vocabulary>gist</vocabulary> as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the same as the word <ja>胸</ja> (chest). So, the gist of your body is your chest (it's at the center, and holds everything together, right?). That's why these words are both read as <ja><reading>むね</reading></ja>.
